The Cat in the Hat
Dr. Seuss March 12, 1957
The Cat in the Hat is a tall anthropomorphic cat, who wears a red and white-striped hat and a red bow tie and sometimes has an umbrella with him mostly green, blue or red. He is a farm cat of Dr. Seuss's short story The Cat in the Hat.

Dr. Seuss
March 2, 1904 - September 24, 1991
Theodor Seuss Geisel (/suːs ˈɡaɪzəl, zɔɪs -/ (audio speaker iconlisten);[2][3][4] March 2, 1904 – September 24, 1991)[5] was an American children's author, political cartoonist, illustrator, poet, animator, and filmmaker. He is known for his work writing and illustrating more than 60 books under the pen name Dr. Seuss (/suːs, zuːs/,[4][6]). His work includes many of the most popular children's books of all time, selling over 600 million copies and being translated into more than 20 languages by the time of his death.[7]

Story Time with Owl
February 25, 1957
Welcome to Story Time with Owl! We curate all the best children's books read aloud on youtube! This channel is for parents and teachers alike and a resource to find great children's literature.

Edited by Athena Wong
Co-Founder Managing Director Last Updated March 21, 2022 Initially Updated March 1, 2022
